misuse: CWE-327: Use of a Broken or Risky Cryptographic Algorithm
description: The use of MD4 algorithm in the code is a misuse, as it is a broken cryptographic algorithm that is not considered secure. It is recommended to use a secure algorithm such as SHA-256 or higher.

misuse: CWE-330: Use of Insufficiently Random Values
description: The use of str.getBytes() to convert a string to a byte array is a misuse, as it may produce a predictable byte array that can be easily guessed or reverse-engineered. It is recommended to use a secure random byte array generation method such as SecureRandom.getSeed() or MessageDigest.update().
recommendation: Replace the use of str.getBytes() with a secure random byte array generation method such as SecureRandom.getSeed() or MessageDigest.update().
